text:
How to remove leftover wax from a glass candle holder: 
1. Pour just off the boil water into candle holder.
2. Leave for approx 1½  hours. Water should still be warmish.
3. Wax would have drifted to the top.
4. Just remove wax and wash container with soapy water.
#Loadshedding
text_html: How to remove leftover wax from a glass candle holder: 1. Pour just off the boil water into candle holder. 2. Leave for approx 1½ hours. Water should still be warmish. 3. Wax would have drifted to the top. 4. Just remove wax and wash container with soapy water. #Loadshedding

text:
As with every other rating agency, S&P Global have the following as distinct positives: 
• credibility and independence of the SA Reserve Bank (SARB)
• independent judiciary 
• free press
We should guard these with our lives.
text_html: As with every other rating agency, S&P Global have the following as distinct positives: • credibility and independence of the SA Reserve Bank (SARB) • independent judiciary • free press We should guard these with our lives.

text: S&P points out that on a per capita basis, SA's growth remains well below emerging market peers. For 2019 they estimate $6,000 to R6,200 - well below the $6,900 in 2013. It has been shrinking every year since 2014, with South Africans, on average, becoming poorer.pic.twitter.com/yTBhQVIhNv

R60bn to plug tax shortfall
R60bn for SOE bail-outs
R300bn in cuts to gvt expenditure/services

text:
Expanded unemployment rate rises to 38.5% from 37.3% a year ago.
That's 10.3 MILLION people.
An increase of half a million people in 12 months.

Youth unemployment (15 - 24yrs) is at 58.2%. Rocketing from 54.9% a year ago.
This is a humanitarian crisis.pic.twitter.com/sHNWhVbCjT
text_html: Expanded unemployment rate rises to 38.5% from 37.3% a year ago. That's 10.3 MILLION people. An increase of half a million people in 12 months. Youth unemployment (15 - 24yrs) is at 58.2%. Rocketing from 54.9% a year ago. This is a humanitarian crisis.pic.twitter.com/sHNWhVbCjT

text: Late October is often very jittery. Oct is seen as the "jinx month" due to the huge sell-offs in 1929, 1987 & 2008 (one of the worst months of the GFC). But statistically it precedes the strongest period for stocks: from late Oct to Jan and often through to April.pic.twitter.com/JML4TBUMqX

But statistically it precedes the strongest period for stocks: from late Oct to Jan and often through to April.pic.twitter.com/JML4TBUMqX

text: A favourite JPMorgan chart puts the crash of 1987 in context. It is just another blip. Although it contained the largest one-day fall ever, it recovered all losses in less than 2 years. The crash of 1929 took 25 years and the 2008 financial crisis took 6 years.pic.twitter.com/UaTJxKlGM9

text: It is 32 years since the Crash of 1987 on Black Monday, 19 Oct 1987. On that day the Dow fell 22.6%, the largest one-day fall in US history. text:
Eskom problems:
a) 6 Eskom units down with boiler tube leaks. 
b) 1 unit at Koeberg down for refueling.
c) Coal conveyor feeding coal to Medupi down, causing Medupi to run at 1/3 of normal.
d) Technical problems at Grootvlei power station.
e) Unplanned breakdowns now at 10500 MW.
text_html: Eskom problems: a) 6 Eskom units down with boiler tube leaks. b) 1 unit at Koeberg down for refueling. c) Coal conveyor feeding coal to Medupi down, causing Medupi to run at 1/3 of normal. d) Technical problems at Grootvlei power station. e) Unplanned breakdowns now at 10500 MW.

text: IMP: I'm out of Implats. NAP may turn out to be a good deal longer term, but shorter term there will be uncertainty about servicing the debt and the price at which a potential vendor placement may be done. Fact that palladium is at an all-time high cannot be ignored.

text: Been contemplating this problem for some time.. Only solution I see is Nedbank buys them & delists them. It'll then owe money to itself, & therefore not need to impair it. Unfortunately, it'll then also own an enlarged property portfolio, but can fiddle valuations to hide losses.

text: Woolies are reticent about their 2nd half Oz sales, saying only that store refurbishment disrupted sales. David Jones pedaled backwards from +0.1% at Dec to -0.8% for the full year. C/Road from 0.7% to 0.5%. DJ online did well +46.8%, contributing 7.7% to total full-year sales.

text: Woolies had a pretty good 2nd half. Seems the anecdotal reports on twitter of an improved ladies' clothing range was dead accurate. 2H same-store-sales for clothing +4.7%. Food +6.5%. No talk of too hot/cold weather or early/late sales for the first time in years.

text: The weighting methodology uses 25% Market Cap. This means it is yield weighted with a tilt to ward the larger property companies.  It also uses the last three years average yield , which therefor rewards companies who consistently pay, a quality overlay.

text: We use a yield weighting methodology (75%) and Market Cap (25%). This means a share with a high yield gets a high weight. However, often shares with high yield are a function of low price not good income growth which is not attractive. Eg to follow.

text: USD/ZAR: At 14.07 it can certainly strengthen further, but there is some support around 14.00. With our parlous politics & SOEs I still see it weaker in the medium term and am using any strength to buy more Rand hedges (and gold). May be wrong, but that's the decision I've made.

text: Hyprop: Some good news as it reduces exposure to Africa. AttAfrica (37.5% held by HYP) sells a Ghana retail centre. States there is 'progress' re the disposal of further African shopping malls. These malls are financed by US$ debt which is a huge drag on Hyprop.

text: Seems any mildly positive comment on any out-of-favour stock is met with sneering. This is short-sighted. The time to look at assets is when they are at fair valuations, not when hyped up to dangerous levels. Sure they can fall further. Picking an absolute bottom is impossible.

text: If there is significant potential upside in a risky stock, it is often worth buying just a bit. So little that it hardly seems worthwhile. Out of every 5 usually one will astonish & delight you. 2 will be ho-hum, 2 cut for small losses. (Silver a possibility, as is HAR DRD JBL)
